name: enable-disable-indep
description: Check if it is possible to enable and disable monitors independently.

steps.description: From an active session plug an external VGA display to the VGA port of the netbook
steps.expected: After a short blackout both screens are actives

steps.description: Click on the username of top bar
Within the menu, select "Settings"
Click on "Displays"
Select the laptop screen, swith the status button to off and click "Apply"
steps.expected: the laptop screen should become black and the desktop should be visible only on your external screen

steps.description: Back to the previous configuration and select your external screen, switch the status to off and click "Apply"
steps.expected: your external screen should become black and the desktop should be visible only on the laptop screen

steps.description: From an active session plug an external VGA display to the VGA port of the netbook
steps.expected: After a short blackout both screens are actives

steps.description: Click on the username of top bar
Within the menu, select "Settings"
Click on "Displays"
Check the box "Miror displays" and click "Apply"
steps.expected: The two displays should show the same thing, the pointer move equally on both screens

name: set-any-display-res
description: Check that any display resolution (from its native resolutions) can be set.

steps.description: From an active session, click on the username of top bar
Within the menu, select "Settings"
Click on "Displays"
Select a screen resolution and click "Apply"
steps.expected: the resolution of the laptop screen should change according to the selected one

steps.description: Repeat the previous step for all available resolutions
steps.expected: All the resolutions are correctly displayed

name: set-any-display-rot
description: "Check that any display rotation can be set.  1 - From an active session, go on the gnome shell status menu and click on ""System Settings"". 2 - In the ""Displays"" panel change the rotation and apply the change. Repeat the process with all available rotation. Pass criteria : the system displays well with all the available rotations."

steps.description: From an active session, click on the username of top bar
Within the menu, select "Settings"
Click on "Displays"
Select a screen rotation and click "Apply"
steps.expected: the rotation of the laptop screen should change according to the selected one

steps.description: Repeat the previous step for all available rotation
steps.expected: All the rotations are correctly displayed

name: set-relative-positioning
description: Set relative positioning of displays (to match physical layout)

steps.description: From an active session plug an external VGA display to the VGA port of the netbook
steps.expected: After a short blackout both screens are actives

steps.description: Click on the username of top bar
Within the menu, select "Settings"
Click on "Displays"
Click the laptop screen icon, drag it on the opposite side and click "Apply"
steps.expected: the pointer should move from one screen to the other according to the set position
